sentences.english: Don’t worry about mother, I’ll cover for you this time.
sentences.chinese: 別擔心媽媽那邊，這一次我會爲你掩護的。

sentences.english: The dense forest screened the guerrillas' movements.
sentences.chinese: 密林掩護了游擊隊員的行動。

sentences.english: The local superstitions regarding the dead were the perfect cover for Evazan's project.
sentences.chinese: 當地對死亡的迷信爲埃瓦讚的項目提供了完美的掩護。

sentences.english: Cover is generally inclined beams, the hinged roof beams and between the base.
sentences.chinese: 掩護梁一般是傾斜的，鉸接在頂梁和底座之間。

sentences.english: In the dark rise sparsely some buildings, screened① by the luxuriant trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些建築稀落地聳立在黑暗裏，被茂盛的樹木掩護着。

sentences.english: Sometimes they can only see their chelloldren through the eyes of a protector.
sentences.chinese: 有時，他們只能看見自己的孩子通過秋水的掩護。

sentences.english: Love is like two halves of the same shell - a perfect match.
sentences.chinese: 愛是是兩個人一起拼成一顆心在線看電視劇掩護。

sentences.english: To them, she's providing cover for the world to neglect Africa.
sentences.chinese: 對他們來說，她正在給世界無視非洲打掩護。

sentences.english: The air raid sirens were suddenly heard to warn people to take shelter at once.
sentences.chinese: 大家忽然聽到了防空警報，急忙尋找掩護。

sentences.english: Under the cover of the mountain , I hurried to flee .
sentences.chinese: 在山民的掩護下，我匆匆逃離。

sentences.english: Table 7 Note:The over current protection should be tested at other load rating.
sentences.chinese: 過流掩護實驗是在其它額定負載時實驗。

sentences.english: Andrew's been pretty good at screening.
sentences.chinese: 在做掩護方面，博古特一直做得很好。

sentences.english: He is just a stalking horse in the election contest.
sentences.chinese: 他在這次競選中是打掩護的馬。

sentences.english: The tractors returning from the construction site provide perfect cover.
sentences.chinese: 從礦場返回的牽引車爲他們提供了完美的掩護。

sentences.english: The airborne units were to secure the flanks of the amphibious assault.
sentences.chinese: 空降部隊的任務是從側翼掩護兩棲進攻。

sentences.english: Element leaders should also try to get superior ground when providing overwatch .
sentences.chinese: 隊長應該選擇較高的地形來提供觀察掩護。

definition: to run away/to flee in disarray
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to open fire/to shoot a gun
member of the same party/member of the same group/accomplice
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
